turn.2: Golden Melody Awards The Golden Melody Awards (), commonly abbreviated as GMA, is an honor awarded by the Ministry of Culture of Taiwan to recognize outstanding achievement in the Mandarin, Taiwanese, Hakka, and Formosan-languages popular and traditional music industry.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The GMAs are awarded on the basis of votes by members of jury, and it has constantly been recognized as the equivalent to the Grammy Awards in Chinese-speaking world.
turn.5: What makes it the equivalent of the Grammy Awards?
turn.6: It shares recognition of the music industry as that of the other performance awards such as the Golden Bell Awards (television) and the Golden Horse Awards (motion pictures).
turn.7: When was the first award given?
turn.8: The 1st Golden Melody Awards was held on January 6, 1990, to honor the popular music production by performers.
turn.9: Was there any controversy with the awards?
turn.10: Following the 1996 ceremony, the Ministry of Culture overhauled many Golden Melody Award categories for 1997.
turn.12: In 1997, the awards were split into separate honors for popular music and traditional music.
